data.title: Emmylou Harris: Where is Emmylou Harris from? Net worth 2023, Age, Salary, Career, Married Life, Relationships, Children, Husbands, Bio, Wiki
data.meta_description: The remarkable solo career of singer-songwriter Emmylou Harris has lasted for more than 40 years. More than 20 million recordings have been sold by her. She has so far put out 70 singles, 26 studio albums (including four albums of joint work with other musicians), four live albums, 11 compilation albums, and three video albums.

Quick Facts

NameEmmylou HarrisAge75 Years OldNick NameEmmylou HarrisBirth NameEmmylou Harris1947-04-02GenderFemaleProfessionSingerPlace Of BirthBirmingham, AlabamaBirth NationUSANationalityAmericanFatherWalter Rutland HarrisMotherEugeniaEthnicityAmerican-WhiteHigh SchoolGar-Field Senior High SchoolUniversityUniversity of North CarolinaMarital StatusMarried and DivorcedHusbandEx-Husband â Tom Slocum, Brian Ahern, Paul KennerleyChildrenMika Hallie Slocum and Meghann AhernSexual OrientationStraightNet Worth$15 millionSource of WealthMusic IndustryHeight5 ft 5 inWeight58 KgEye ColorBlueHair ColorGrayBody TypeAverageLinksWikipedia, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

American singer, songwriter, and musician Emmylou Harris. She is renowned for the folk, pop, rock, and country music she composes. The âqueen of country rockâ refers to her. Over the course of her career, Harris has released dozens of albums and singles and has garnered numerous accolades, including 14 Grammy Awards, the Polar Music Prize, and induction into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2008. She also joined the Grand Ole Opry in 1992.

She has experienced three failed marriages, to Tom Slocum, Brian Ahern, and Paul Kennerley. Mika Hallie Slocum and Meghann Ahern are her two children. Over the course of her more than 40-year musical career, Harris has collaborated with notable artists like Bob Dylan, Dolly Parton, and Linda Ronstadt. She performs as a solo artist, bandleader, singer-songwriter, backing vocalist, interpreter of other composersâ works, and duet partner. She received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award in 2018.

How much is the Net worth of Emmylou Harris?

The remarkable solo career of singer-songwriter Emmylou Harris has lasted for more than 40 years. More than 20 million recordings have been sold by her. She has so far put out 70 singles, 26 studio albums (including four albums of joint work with other musicians), four live albums, 11 compilation albums, and three video albums.

Her primary source of money is the music business. Emmylou Harris is a gifted vocalist who, as of 2023, had a $15 million fortune. She released multiple albums and songs to earn this wealth. She lives in a large bungalow of her own and has branded cars in her garage. With the money she makes from her job, she leads a luxurious life.

Early Years: Where is Emmylou Harris from?

Emmylou Harris was born in a military family on April 2, 1947. She is American and hails from Birmingham, Alabama. She was raised in Woodbridge, Virginia, and North Carolina. Her mother, Eugenia Harris (1921-2014), was a military spouse during World War II, and her father, Walter Rutland Harris (1921-1993), was a Marine Corps officer. In 1952, her father was taken prisoner of war in Korea for ten months before being reported missing in action. In 2022, Harris will be 75 years old. She is an American national and a member of the White American ethnic group.

The vocalist received her schooling at Gar-Field Senior High School, where she graduated as salutatorian of her class. She received a theatre scholarship to the University of North Carolina in Greensboro, where she started her musical studies and picked up the guitar to play songs by Pete Seeger, Bob Dylan, and Joan Baez. She left college early to pursue her musical goals and relocated to New York City, where she worked as a server to support herself while singing folk songs at coffeehouses in Greenwich Village during the 1960s folk music boom.

What is the Professional Career of Emmylou Harris?

Jubilee Records initially distributed Emmylou Harrisâ debut album âGliding Birdâ in 1969. She then gave a trio performance alongside Gerry Mule and Tom Guidera. She collaborated with artist Gram Parsons in 1971 when he was searching for a female vocalist to work with on his debut solo album, âGP.â Also, she also went on tour with Parsonsâ band, âThe Fallen Angels,â and they were excellent in singing duets and harmonies. After that, Emmylou and Parsons collaborated on the studio album âGrievous Angel,â but Parsons passed away in his motel room on September 19, 1973, precluding the albumâs release.

In 1974, the record had a posthumous release. Another posthumous Parsons album, âSleepless Nights,â released in 1976, featured three further tracks from his sessions with Harris. She began her solo career in 1975 with the release of her second album, âPieces of the Sky.â There were two popular songs on the album, âIf I Could Only Earn Your Loveâ and âToo Far Gone.â Emmylouâs third studio album, âElite Hotel,â was released in December 1975. In 1976, âElite Hotelâ won a Grammy for Best Female Country Vocal Performance. Following that, she had her album âLuxury Linerâ released by Reprise Records in January 1977.

More on Career

1978 saw the publication of her subsequent album, âQuarter Moon in a Ten Cent Village.â On the Billboard charts, the album peaked at No. 3. It included the Dolly Parton song âTo Daddyâ and the single âLeave Louisiana in the Wide Daylight.â Her subsequent album, âBlue Kentucky Girl,â had a sizable portion of traditional country music in the style of Loretta Lynn and Kitty Wells. Warner Bros. Records distributed the album in 1979. With the bluegrass-influenced album âRoses in the Snow,â Harris further delved into the history of country music in the 1980s. She collaborated with Roy Orbison to record âThat Lovinâ You Feelinâ Againâ in 1980.

Her debut album, âEvangeline,â was released by Warner Bros. Records in January 1981. This was followed by âCimarron,â âWhite Shoes,â âThe Ballad of Sally Rose,â âThirteen,â and âAngel Band.â She released the diverse âBluebirdâ album in 1989, which featured songs by the McGarrigle Sisters, Tom Rush, and Rodney Crowell. âHeartbreak Hill,â one of her top-ten country singles, was on it. Her 1993 CD, âCowgirlâs Prayer,â was a collection of mainly somber songs with a few rockers thrown in. She experimented with many sounds on the 1995 album âWrecking Ball,â which she published. The album received favorable reviews and became well-known for its ethereal sounds.

More on Career

The next year, in 2000, she released the album âRed Dirt Girl,â which peaked at No. 3 on the Billboard country album charts. Her album âStumble into Graceâ was released in 2003. On the Billboard country albums list, it peaked at No. 6. The 2008 release âEverything I Meant to Beâ peaked at No. 4 on Top Country Albums. It gave rise to the single âHow She Could Sang the Wildwood Flowerâ and received a Grammy Award nomination. In 2011, she released the album âHard Bargain,â which made its U.S. Billboard Top Country Albums debut at No. 3. She paid tribute to her late mentor Gram Parsons in the opening song, âThe Road.â

Old Yellow Moon, her follow-up album, was released on February 26, 2013. Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell, two American country music singer-songwriters, collaborated on the album. It is Harrisâs twenty-seventh and Crowellâs fourteenth studio album, respectively. Nonesuch Records released âThe Traveling Kind,â a joint effort with Rodney Crowell, on May 12. The Life & Music of Emmylou Harris, a tribute concert that was held in her honor in 2016, was later made available as a Video and a live CD. She then gave a performance at the 2019 Concert and Induction Ceremony for the Musicians Hall of Fame and Museum. Nonesuch Records issued âRamble in Music City: The Lost Concertâ in 2021.

Who is the husband of Emmylou Harris?

Emmylou Harris has three previous marriages. In 1969, she got married for the first time to the songwriter Tom Slocum. Their one-year union came to an end in divorce in 1970. Her second marriage, to Brian Ahern, began in 1977 and ended in divorce the following year. In 1985, she then exchanged vows a third time. In 1993, she filed for divorce from her third husband, Paul Kennerley. Harris is currently single and not in a relationship.

With her first husband, Tom Slocum, Harris had a daughter named Mika Hallie Slocum, who was born on March 15, 1970. She and her second husband, Brian Ahern, also had a daughter named Meghann Ahern, who was born on September 9, 1979. She has a grandson born in 2012 and a granddaughter born in 2009.

Body Measurement: What is Emmylou Harrisâ height?

Emmylou Harris is a stunning singer with a distinctive voice in folk, rock, pop, and country. She has a gray color for her hair and captivating blue eyes. She has a very fit body. Harris is 1.65 m (5 feet 5 inches) or 165 cm tall, and she weighs 58 Kilograms. She is of ordinary physical stature. She is a vegetarian and pays close attention to what she eats.

Trivia and Facts

She is an animal lover who named her rescue center â Bonaparte Retreat â in Nashville after her dog died in 2002.

She is a strong advocate for womenâs rights. She has performed many times at the Lilith Fair, which is an all-female concert.

She is a fervent supporter of the LGBT community and believes in equal rights.

She did not start as a country singer; she originally started her career in folk music.

She won 14 Grammy Awards over the course of her career.
